title.en: Six Aspirations to Be Continually Recited

text.en: In all my lives, wherever I am born,
May I obtain the seven qualities of birth in higher realms.1
As soon as I am born, may I meet the Dharma,
text.en-trans: kyé mataktu chö dang tré gyur ching

text.en: And have the freedom to practise it correctly.
Then, may I please the noble guru,
text.en-trans: der yang lama dampa nyé jé ching

text.en: And put the Dharma into action day and night.
text.en-trans: nyin dang tsen du chö la chöpar shok

text.en: May I realize the Dharma, actualize its innermost meaning,
text.en-trans: chö tok né ni nyingpö dön drub té

text.en: And so cross the ocean of existence in this very life.
text.en-trans: tsé der sipé gyatso galwar shok

text.en: May I teach the sacred Dharma to beings wandering in saṃsāra,
text.en-trans: sipar dampé chö rab tönjé ching

text.en: And never tire or weary of working to help others.
text.en-trans: zhenpen drub la kyo ngal mepar shok

text.en: Through my vast and impartial service to others,
text.en-trans: lab chen zhendön chokri mepa yi

text.en: May all beings attain buddhahood together, as one!
